intro: Taraxia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are typically green with a waxy coating, and it produces a distinctive yellow flower that develops into a white pappus-based seed head. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Taraxia palmeri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
